poem:
### Revamp for the Earth

In cities' echo,  
brownfields bloom anew—  
councils cradle £68m  
on wise fingers.  
  
Brick upon brick,  
a living chorus;  
the streets lean in,  
stories brewed from old soil,  
  
unlocked from rusted dreams  
by hands and homes.  
A quiet song,  
builders whisper to the land.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
